noun.description: A rounded vault forming the roof of a building or structure, typically with a circular base.
examples: the dome of St. Paul's Cathedral

noun.description: A thing shaped like a dome.

verb.description: (of stratified rock or a surface) become rounded in formation; swell.

origin: Early 16th century (in dome (sense 3 of the noun)): from Latin domus; other senses are via French dôme, from Italian duomo cathedral, dome.
